name: N2 Grammar - 以来/から/など
description: Grammar patterns from Nihongo Soumatome N2

front.text: 日本に来て**以来**、毎日勉強している。

back.description: Used to express 'since' or 'ever since' a specific point in time. Emphasizes that the action/state has continued from that point until now.
back.nuance: More formal than から. Often used for significant life events or turning points.
back.example_translation: Ever since I came to Japan, I've been studying every day.

front.text: 一生懸命勉強した**のに**、試験に落ちた。

back.description: Expresses contrast or unexpected result. Shows disappointment or surprise that the expected outcome didn't happen.
back.nuance: Stronger emotional emphasis than でも or が. Shows speaker's disappointment.
back.example_translation: Despite studying hard, I failed the exam.
